Methods inherited from interface com.algodeal.marketrunner.strategies.StrategyEvents
onClose, onOpen, onPortfolioReset, onPositionChanged, onPositionChanged, onPositionClosed, onPositionClosed, onPositionClosed, onPositionOpened, onPositionOpened, onPositionOpened, onStrategyStart, onStrategyStop
 

Method Detail

getInstrument

Instrument getInstrument()
Returns the current instrument. When a strategy runs on multiple instruments, there is one instance of the strategy class for each instrument.

getBarType

BarType getBarType()
Returns the current bar type. When a strategy runs on multiple bar types, there is one instance of the strategy class for each type.

getBars

BarSeries getBars()
Returns the passed market data bars for the current instrument and frequency.

When called in the StrategyEvents.onOpen(OpenPrice) method, the last bar in this series is the previous bar (since the current bar is not known yet). When called in the StrategyEvents.onClose(Bar) method, the last bar in this series is the current bar.

getBarsFor

BarSeries getBarsFor(Instrument instrument,
                     BarType barType)
Convenience method that returns the bar series associated with the given instrument and frequency.

Note that the bars are made available as they are created, and thus any given bar series is not necessarily in sync with any other one

Parameters:
instrument - is the instrument represented by this bar series
barType - is the frequency of the bar series
Returns:
a bar series for given instrument and frequency. Throw an illegal argument exception if you attempted to load a non existent combination of instrument and frequency

getPosition

Position getPosition()
Convenience method to get the position for the current instrument : getPortfolio().getPosition(getInstrument()) When run on multiple instruments, returns only position for current instrument.

See Also:
getPortfolio()

getPositionAmount

double getPositionAmount()
Returns the size of the position for the current instrument, in the currency of the current instrument.

See Also:
getInstrument(), getPosition()

buy

MarketOrder buy(long quantity,
                String comment)
Places a buy order for the current instrument.

Parameters:
quantity - the number of contracts to buy
comment - free text that will appear on the tables of orders and transactions
Returns:
the generated order, for further processing (such as cancellation)

                 long quantity,
                 String comment)

Parameters:

comment - free text that will appear on the tables of orders and transactions

closePosition

Order closePosition(String comment)
Closes the position on the current instrument. Note that if you call this multiple times and the resulting orders dosn't get executed in between (markets closed for instance), multiple orders will get executed and position will not close properly.

Parameters:
comment - free text that will appear on the tables of orders and transactions
Returns:
the generated order used to close the position, for further processing (such as cancellation), or a dummy order if no order has been created

closePosition

Order closePosition(Tradeable instrument,
                    String comment)
Closes the position on the specified instrument. Note that if you call this multiple times and the resulting orders dosn't get executed in between (markets closed for instance), multiple orders will get executed and position will not close properly.

Parameters:
comment - free text that will appear on the tables of orders and transactions
Returns:
the generated order used to close the position, for further processing (such as cancellation), or a dummy order if no order has been created

closePositionsAllInstruments

void closePositionsAllInstruments(String comment)
Closes all positions currently opened for all known instruments.
  • Note that this doesn't allow further tracking of orders, since no orders are being returned. Use closePosition(Tradeable, String) if you want to track the resulting orders.
  • Note that if you call this multiple times and the resulting orders doesn't get executed in between (markets closed for instance), multiple orders will get issued and position will not close properly.

cancelOrders

void cancelOrders()
Cancels all orders on the current instrument.

cancelOrders

void cancelOrders(Tradeable... instruments)
Cancels all orders on the specified instruments.

cancelOrders

void cancelOrders(Order... ordersToCancel)
Cancels all specified orders on the specified instruments.

cancelOrdersAllInstruments

void cancelOrdersAllInstruments()
Cancels all orders on all known instruments.

cancelOrder

void cancelOrder(Order order)
Cancels the specified order.

getPortfolio

Portfolio getPortfolio()
Gets the portfolio containing the list of instruments traded by the strategy, the position on each instrument and the list of Orders

hasPosition

boolean hasPosition()
Convenience method for getPortfolio().hasPosition(). When run on multiple instruments, returns true if the position on any instrument is not flat.

newIndicator

IndicatorFactory newIndicator()
Allows the creation of a new indicator using the indicator builder API
